generif.text: Up-regulation of cytokine inducible SH2-containing protein is associated with adult T-cell leukemia

BP.term: protein kinase C-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway

name: cytokine inducible SH2 containing protein

wikipathways.name: Regulation of toll-like receptor signaling pathway

summary: The protein encoded by this gene contains a SH2 domain and a SOCS box domain. The protein thus belongs to the cytokine-induced STAT inhibitor (CIS), also known as suppressor of cytokine signaling (SOCS) or STAT-induced STAT inhibitor (SSI), protein family. CIS family members are known to be cytokine-inducible negative regulators of cytokine signaling. The expression of this gene can be induced by IL2, IL3, GM-CSF and EPO in hematopoietic cells. Proteasome-mediated degradation of this protein has been shown to be involved in the inactivation of the erythropoietin receptor. Multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2008].
